alert.note: Alert for Coastal Ocean; Ocean; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 11:26AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ocean and south central Monmouth Counties through NOON EDT... At 1125 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pleasant Plains, or over Toms River, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Lakewood, Jackson, Beachwood, Point Pleasant Beach, Lakehurst, Mantoloking, Leisure Village, Dover Beaches North, Holiday City South, Pleasant Plains, Cedar Glen West, Leisure Village East, Holiday City-Berkeley, Ramtown, Brick Township, Freewood Acres, Leisure Village West-Pine Lake Park, Pine Ridge At Crestwood and Vista Center. This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 24 and 28. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 80 and 94. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
